mc_ode_solver.altogether.importance_sampling(ode_func, t, y, dt, num_samples=1000)[source]

Perform importance sampling for the ODE solver with proper time step integration.

Parameters: - ode_func: Function representing dy/dt = f(t, y) - t: Current time step - y: Current state - dt: Time step size - num_samples: Number of importance samples

Returns: - Next state estimate

mc_ode_solver.altogether.quasi_monte_carlo(ode_func, t, y, dt, dim=1, scramble=True)[source]

Use a quasi-random sequence for Monte Carlo integration with proper time step.

Parameters: - ode_func: Function representing dy/dt = f(t, y) - t: Current time step - y: Current state - dt: Time step size - dim: Dimensionality of the sequence - scramble: Whether to scramble the sequence

Returns: - Next state estimate

mc_ode_solver.benchmarks module

mc_ode_solver.benchmarks.linear_ode(t, y)[source]

Define a simple linear ODE: dy/dt = -2y.

Parameters:

  • t (float) – Current time step (not used in the linear ODE, but required for generality).

  • y (float) – Current state (solution) of the system.

Returns:

The rate of change of y at time t.

Return type:

dydt (float)

mc_ode_solver.benchmarks.nonlinear_ode(t, y)[source]

Define a nonlinear ODE: dy/dt = y^2 - 1.

Parameters:

  • t (float) – Current time step (not used in the nonlinear ODE, but required for generality).

  • y (float) – Current state (solution) of the system.

Returns:

The rate of change of y at time t.

Return type:

dydt (float)

mc_ode_solver.samplers module

mc_ode_solver.samplers.importance_sampling(ode_func, t, y, dt, num_samples=1000)[source]

Perform importance sampling for the ODE solver with proper time step integration.

Parameters:

  • ode_func (function) – The ODE function representing dy/dt = f(t, y).

  • t (float) – The current time step.

  • y (float) – The current state (solution) at time t.

  • dt (float) – The time step size for integration.

  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to generate for importance sampling.

Returns:

The updated state estimate after performing importance sampling.

Return type:

y_next (float)

mc_ode_solver.samplers.quasi_monte_carlo(ode_func, t, y, dt, dim=1, scramble=True)[source]

Use a quasi-random sequence for Monte Carlo integration with proper time step.

Parameters:

  • ode_func (function) – The ODE function representing dy/dt = f(t, y).

  • t (float) – The current time step.

  • y (float) – The current state (solution) at time t.

  • dt (float) – The time step size for integration.

  • dim (int) – The dimensionality of the sequence (default is 1).

  • scramble (bool) – Whether to scramble the sequence (default is True).

Returns:

The updated state estimate after applying quasi-Monte Carlo.

Return type:

y_next (float)

mc_ode_solver.solver module

class mc_ode_solver.solver.MonteCarloODESolver(ode_func, y0, t_span, method='quasi_monte_carlo', num_samples=1000)[source]

Bases: object

A solver for ordinary differential equations (ODEs) using Monte Carlo methods.

The solver supports two methods for Monte Carlo integration: importance sampling and quasi-Monte Carlo.

ode_func

The ODE function to solve, where the function returns dy/dt = f(t, y).

Type:

function

y0

The initial condition for the ODE.

Type:

float

t_span

A tuple representing the time span (t0, tf) for the solution.

Type:

tuple

method

The Monte Carlo method to use (‘importance_sampling’ or ‘quasi_monte_carlo’).

Type:

str

num_samples

The number of Monte Carlo samples to use for the integration.

Type:

int

solve()[source]

Solve the ODE using the selected Monte Carlo method.

This method iteratively computes the ODE solution at each time step using the selected sampling method (importance sampling or quasi-Monte Carlo).

Returns:

An array of time values. solutions (np.ndarray): An array of solution values corresponding to the time steps.

Return type:

t_vals (np.ndarray)

mc_ode_solver.utils module

mc_ode_solver.utils.validate_ode_func(ode_func)[source]

Validate the ODE function to ensure it is callable and returns a valid result.
